qas.question: Why is the name the British Isles disputed in Ireland?
Does the Government of Ireland use the British Isle term?

answers.text: does not recognise or use the term

qas.question: What is the alternative name that Government of Ireland uses instead of British Isles?
Does the Government of Ireland's London embassy use the name British Isles?

answers.text: its embassy in London discourages its use

plausible_answers.text: due to the association of the word British with Ireland

qas.question: Why does Britian dispute the name British Isles?
What term does the British government not recognize?
What name does the government of Britian use instead of the British Isles?
What does Britian prefer to refer to as the Atlantic Archipelago?
The term Atlantic Archipelago is considered controversial in which country?
Which term does the Atlantic government not recognize?
The embassy in Paris discourages the use of what term?lon
Which country names are used as an alternative to the phrase Atlantic Archipelago?

context: The term <b5_0><b7_0><b9_0><b10_0>British Isles<b10_0/><b9_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/> is controversial in <b8_0>Ireland<b8_0/>, where there are objections to its usage <b4_0>due to the <a0_0>association of the word British<a0_0/> with Ireland<b4_0/>. The Government of Ireland <a1_0>does not recognise or use the term<a1_0/> and <a3_0>its embassy in London discourages its use<a3_0/>. As a result, <b6_0><b11_0>Britain and Ireland<b11_0/><b6_0/> is used as an alternative description, and <a2_0>Atlantic Archipelago<a2_0/> has had limited use among a minority in academia, although British Isles is still commonly employed. Within them, they are also sometimes referred to as these islands.
